channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Asia Stocks to Climb as US Rally Pauses, Oil Soars: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks in Asia were set to edge higher on Wednesday, shrugging off a pause on Wall Street after a six-day rally, as traders looked for fresh catalysts. Oil jumped on a report that Israel is planning strikes on Iran.
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck

item.title: S&P 500 Falls After $8.6 Trillion Surge From Lows: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street’s rally took a breather on Tuesday, with stocks falling as traders awaited fresh catalysts after a six-day run that put the S&P 500 up almost 20% from its April lows.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Renault's Ampere: On Track to Break Even This Year
item.description: Renault's EV & software arm Ampere, is confident the company will break even this year. Ampere CFO Vincent Piquet discusses the outlook for the French firm with David Ingles on "Bloomberg: The China Show." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Mahindra Auto Hopes Trade Talks Can Open New Markets
item.description: Nalinikanth Gollagunta, Automotive Division CEO at Mahindra & Mahindra, says he hopes trade negotiations between India and other countries can open new markets. He speaks with David Ingles on "Bloomberg: The China Show." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Japan’s GPIF to Invest $500 Million in US PE Firm Thoma Bravo
item.description: Japan’s Government Pension Investment Fund said it’s investing $500 million in a fund managed by US private equity firm Thoma Bravo, as part of its effort to boost alternative assets.
item.dc:creator: Nao Sano

item.title: Options Traders Are Boosting Bearish Dollar Views to Record
item.description: Currency options traders are now more pessimistic than they’ve ever been about the dollar’s path over the next year, according to one commonly-cited measure of investor sentiment.
item.dc:creator: Carter Johnson

item.title: Trump Says Golden Dome System Will Be Operational in Three Years
item.description: President Donald Trump vowed that a “Golden Dome” missile-defense shield should be “fully operational” by the end of his term, saying it would be able to protect the US from threats including ballistic missiles, hypersonics and advanced cruise missiles. “We will truly be completing the job President Reagan started 40 years ago,” Trump said in the Oval Office, in reference to Ronald Reagan’s unfulfilled quest for a space-based missile defense system, widely known as “Star Wars.” Trump’s vow is an ambitious goal given that much of the technology around a missile-defense system remains unproven, especially plans for space-based interceptors to knock down incoming ballistic missiles. Congress is seeking $25 billion to begin work on the system and Trump said it could cost $175 billion overall. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: What to Expect From Retail Earnings Amid Tariff Uncertainty
item.description: Adrienne Yih, Barclays senior retail analyst, discusses the outlook for retail earnings amid tariff uncertainty on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Teneo's Kajiwara on C-Suite Sentiment Amid Tariff Tensions
item.description: Kevin Kajiwara, Teneo co-president of political risk advisory, discusses the state of CEO sentiment amid recent tariff tensions on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Take-Two, QXO Launch $2 Billion Wave of Share Sales After Hours
item.description: A trio of companies kicked off a surge of large share sales after the close of US trading on Tuesday, in deals that could raise at least $2 billion in aggregate.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Rockstar Games' Grand Theft Auto 6 trailer. Photographer: Chris Delams/Getty Images

item.title: Google Announces Smart Glasses Partnerships
item.description: Google announces partnerships with Warby Parker and Gentle Monster to make AR smart glasses with AI applications. Sameer Samat, president of Google’s Android Ecosystem, discusses the plans with Bloomberg’s Jackie Davalos at Google I/O. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UK Sanctions British Accountant for Alleged Russia Ship Deals
item.description: The UK sanctioned an English accountant for allegedly helping Russia expand the fleet of tankers it uses to covertly ship crude around the globe.
item.dc:creator: Emma Sanchez

media:content.media:description: Oil tanker. Photographer: Marcelo del Pozo/Bloomberg

item.title: Brazilian Airline Gol Wins Approval of Chapter 11 Restructuring
item.description: Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes SA said it obtained U.S. bankruptcy court approval for the Brazilian airline’s restructuring plan that cuts about $1.6 billion of debt while maintaining Abra Group Limited as its largest indirect shareholder.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Randles

media:content.media:description: A Gol Airlines Boeing 737-800 passenger aircraft taxis at Santos Dumont Airport (SDU) in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on Sunday, Jan. 28, 2024. Gol Aereas Inteligentes SA filed for bankruptcy, capping the Brazilian airline's ill-fated efforts to bounce back from the Covid-19 pandemic. Photographer: Leonardo Carrato/Bloomberg

item.title: Ray Dalio Says Fed Should Not Cut Rates Now
item.description: Ray Dalio, Bridgewater Associates founder, says the Federal Reserve should not be cutting interest rates right now. He speaks to Bloomberg’s Sonali Basak at the BNP Paribas’ Global Markets Conference.

item.title: Take-Two Dips as Video-Game Maker Preps $1 Billion Stock Sale
item.description: Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. shares fell as much as 5% in extended trading after the company announced plans to sell $1 billion of new stock to investors.
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: Grand Theft Auto VI is now slated to release in May 2026

item.title: Google Makes AI Agent Prototype Available to US Users
item.description: Google has released its AI agent research prototype Project Mariner to users in the US. Jaclyn Konzelmann, director of product management for Google Labs, speaks about the human-AI agent interactions with Bloomberg’s Jackie Davalos at Google I/O. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Traders Brace for 10-Year Yield at 5% as Selloff Sours Risk Mood
item.description: Traders are piling into bets that long-term Treasury yields will surge on concerns around the US government’s swelling debt and deficits, a situation made more precarious by President Donald Trump’s tax-cut bill.
item.dc:creator: Edward Bolingbroke

item.title: S&P 500 Snaps 6-Day Win Streak | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Set to Hit Deposit Insurance Fund Target Ratio by End of 2025
item.description: The US government’s bedrock fund meant to protect depositors in the event of a bank failure is poised to reach its legal target ratio by the end of 2025 — about three years ahead of schedule.
item.dc:creator: Katanga Johnson

media:content.media:description: The lobby of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. (FDIC) headquarters in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, March 13, 2023. US authorities took extraordinary measures to shore up confidence in the financial system after the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, introducing a new backstop for banks that Federal Reserve officials said was big enough to protect the entire nation's deposits.

item.title: S&P 500 Slumps, Halting Six-Day Climb as Tech Leads Shares Lower
item.description: US stocks fell on Tuesday after climbing for six consecutive trading sessions as investors parsed corporate earnings and assessed a bevy of Federal Reserve speeches for clues on the trajectory of interest rates.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

item.title: Venezuela Frees American as Chevron Waiver Is Set to Be Extended
item.description: Venezuela released an American citizen on the same day the US was set to give Chevron Corp. another 60-day waiver to operate in the country, part of a push by President Nicolas Maduro’s government and some voices in the Trump administration to improve ties.
item.dc:creator: Fabiola Zerpa, Nick Wadhams

media:content.media:description: A pump jack stands near an oil spill at a Petroleos de Venezuela SA (PDVSA) facility in the Orinoco Belt of El Tigre, Venezuela, on Friday, Oct. 12, 2018. State-owned PDVSA doesn't publish statistics, but environmentalists and analysts keep seemingly endless lists of examples of wayward crude - unleashed by busted valves, ripped gaskets, and cracked pipes - that they say has polluted waterways and farmland and probably has seeped into the nation's aquifers. Photographer: Bloomberg/Bloomberg

item.title: SSGA's Hung on Fed Rate Cuts, Dollar Weakness
item.description: State Street Global Advisors President and CEO Yie-Hsin Hung says the Federal Reserve should cut interest rates three times in the second half of this year to support the weakening economy. Hung speaks with David Rubenstein for an episode of Bloomberg Wealth. This interview was recorded April 3 in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Fed Is in Wait-and-See Mode, Pimco's Clarida Says
item.description: Richard Clarida, Pimco managing director and global economic adviser, says the Federal Reserve might not cut rates until the end of Jerome Powell's term as chairman on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SSGA's Hung on Tariff Impact to the US Economy
item.description: State Street Global Advisors President and CEO Yie-Hsin Hung says she believes the recent tariff increases will likely have a negative impact on US economic growth and inflation. SSGA is one of the world's largest asset managers with nearly $5 trillion in assets under management. Hung speaks with David Rubenstein for an episode of Bloomberg Wealth. This interview was recorded April 3 in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chicago’s O’Hare Airport Seeks Up to $4.3 Billion of Muni Debt
item.description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson will seek approval from aldermen to sell as much as $4.3 billion of debt for O’Hare International Airport, according to a filing posted on the city clerk’s website.
item.dc:creator: Shruti Singh

media:content.media:description: Travelers take the escalator up to Terminal 1 at O’Hare International Airport in Chicago on Friday, Sept. 1, 2023.

item.title: Uber Squeezes More From Aurora Stake With $1.2 Billion Bond Sale
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc.’s $1.2 billion exchangeable bond deal, linked to its shares in a self-driving truck firm, shows why the unusual financial maneuver can be more attractive than a typical stake sale, according to observers.
item.dc:creator: Yiqin Shen, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: An Aurora Innovation Inc. driverless truck at the company's terminal in Palmer, Texas, US, on Wednesday, Dec. 28, 2023. Driverless trucks with no humans on board will soon cruise Texas, highways if three startup firms have their way, despite objections from critics who say financial pressures, not safety, is behind the timetable.

item.title: Trump To Host Memecoin Dinner | Bloomberg Crypto 05/20/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Crypto" covers the people, transactions, and technology shaping the world of decentralized finance. Today's guests: BitGo CEO Mike Belshe, Ledger Chief Experience Officer Ian Rogers, and Bloomberg's Lydia Beyoud and Olga Kharif. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Jimmy Fallon Offered $1 Million Air-Taxi Bet by Short Seller
item.description: Air taxi company Archer Aviation Inc. has been targeted by short sellers before, but the latest attack has an unusual twist: A proposed $1 million “friendly wager” with the TV show host Jimmy Fallon.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke, Sam Potter

media:content.media:description: Adam Goldstein during an interview with host Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight Show in New York on May 15.

item.title: Dell Continues to Innovate the AI Factory
item.description: Arthur Lewis, president of Dell’s Infrastructure Solutions Group, discusses how the company continues to innovate on the AI Factory and its partnership with Nvidia. Lewis speaks with Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow at Dell Technologies World. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump to Host Top Memecoin Holders
item.description: President Donald Trump will be hosting a high-profile dinner with the top memecoin holders later this week. One high profile holder, Crypto Entrepreneur Justin Sun, announced on social media that he will be attending the event. Bloomberg's Olga Kharif reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
